summary: Suicide deaths and attempts within the military community are devastating events that can also harm unit morale and readiness. Servicemembers assigned to remote locations outside the contiguous U.S. can experience isolation, less access to mental health resources, and other challenges that may increase their suicide risk. We testified before a Senate subcommittee about our examination of suicide data for servicemembers at remote installations, prevention efforts...
title: Military Suicide: Preliminary Observations on Actions Needed to Enhance Prevention and Response Affecting Certain Remote Installations
